title: Free Market Capitalist
author: Free Market Capitalist
content: This is a British Hodl slogan, which I think is both funny and quite true.It especially refers to countries with high GDP, if you live in USA or UK, don't think that holding 0,01 BTC will make you very rich in the future. Today a whole bitcoin already costs more than the average annual salary. So, for the first part, getting to 1 bitcoin may be difficult but I believe it's a good goal. The one I like the most is the second part: you buy bitcoin, hold it and shut the fuck up. If the price goes down, if rates go up, if the economy, if blah blah blah blah, you keep accumulating bitcoin and shut the fuck up. The third has been proven true for the past 16 years, and all indications are that it will continue to be true.I believe that if you follow the first two hints, the third statement will be true. What do you think?

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Firstly if you have the luxury to get one BTC now and still sustain your good standard of living then I think you are not financially doing bad, going with the price of Bitcoin you have to be doing atleast financially ok to afford that. One other thing is that you shouldn't borrow funds to invest in Bitcoin or in crypto-currency generally, you can grow your portfolio and in a long run grow your wealth so even if you can't afford one Bitcoin you are still good.

comments.author: Lida93
comments.body: Quote from: Free Market Capitalist on Today at 08:39:01 AMWhat do you think?I do think the speaker from the YouTube video was right, every circle people are getting priced out of being able to afford 1btc because the value of bitcoin continues to rise with each circle. Which is what makes it a necessity for those who can afford buying 1bitcoin today to stop hesitating because if you look at the price history of bitcoin from Inception anyone would agree that the price we have today would be double or more in the next two decades in the future, something fiat can't do because it uas no scarcity or limit for print.For those of us who can't afford having 1btc we just keep accumulating and building our portfolio with what our annual salary can make do.and shut the fuck up

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: Honestly I have 1 Bitcoin, but I have nothing else than that. Obviously it's not easy, I think I spent for 4 years to get it.I don't think myself rich or financial freedom, because I live in rented house, use entry level phone that I bought 4 years ago, drive cheap motorcycle, etc and I live frugally. Compared to my friends who have better lifestyle.I guess people who think that having 1 Bitcoin is rich because Average Joe only invest less than 10% of their wealth in Bitcoin.Imagine if they have 1 Bitcoin that worth of $87K, this will make people think their total wealth are $870K.

comments.author: AsvXrin
comments.body: Bitcoin's been around for 16 years now and it's still kicking which says something. I love how it's scarce, that's gotta mean something for its value down the road. Getting to a whole BTC feels like a stretch for me but even stacking some smaller amounts seems worth it. I'm in it for the long haul, keeping risks in check. It's not my only thing, I mix it up a bit, but bitcoin's definitely a big piece of the puzzle for me. Patience is the name of the game here.

Today a whole bitcoin already costs more than the average annual salary. I honestly don't know if anyone from a Western country will be able to become “incredibly rich” by holding just 1 BTC. Rich yeah I can see it, but I doubt the "incredibly" part  Apart from that, I agree with the idea of accumulating as much BTC as possible regardless of the rate, current events, and other things. DCAing is still the best way to go for most of us in my opinion.

comments.author: Synchronice
comments.body: Quote from: Helena Yu on Today at 10:08:40 AMHonestly I have 1 Bitcoin, but I have nothing else than that. Obviously it's not easy, I think I spent for 4 years to get it.I don't think myself rich or financial freedom, because I live in rented house, use entry level phone that I bought 4 years ago, drive cheap motorcycle, etc and I live frugally. Compared to my friends who have better lifestyle.What are your plans? To continue your lifestyle and hold 1 Bitcoin maybe till it reaches 1 million dollar? I think that (it's just my opinion) it's not a good idea to hold 1 Bitcoin if your lifestyle is still the same like working 9-5 job and having a frugal lifestyle. It might be a good idea to convert that Bitcoin to cash and start a business like become an influencer if you can or open a small bakery or something like that. This way, you'll create a business that will generate more money than your job does or you'll also work your job and get additional income from your small business. This way, you'll easily collect 1 Bitcoin again (and more than that) and you'll have more financial freedom than before.

Today a whole bitcoin already costs more than the average annual salary. 0,01 BTC and its cost is small with people in developed and high income countries but with people who are living in developing countries, third world, and have low income, it's too much and perhaps big capital with them.Get richer, in my opinion is with ROI, and you will get same ROI by investing in either 0,01 BTC or 1 BTC. The profit in $ would be different by differences in initial capitals but ROIs are the same.With poor people, they will still get richer by investing in 0,01 BTC because it is big initial investment capital with them, so profit from it would be big with them too.

comments.author: bhadz
comments.body: Even people from my country, owning 1 bitcoin could significantly change our lives but it won't make us live like a king. Although there's a sense of living financially free if someone has that. No need to worry about future expenses as long as the price of Bitcoin maintain at its level now. But I won't complain with that because we're on the phase that we're trying to get into the Bitcoin rush. Whoever gets it at the earliest deserves what it will be in the future. I think wherever we live, owning 1 BTC should be the goal of most. Because each side are dealing with almost the same problem, third world and developing countries earning low salary and the expenses are increasing and the same goes with the first world countries.

Rich yeah I can see it, but I doubt the "incredibly" part  That depends on the returns you believe you can get with Bitcoin. If you go with Saylor’s bull case, that’s $50M per bitcoin; the base case is $13M. It won’t be enough to buy you an island, a private jet, and a yacht, but in any developed country, with over $10M in net worth, you’ll be in the top 1%.

Although there's a sense of living financially free if someone has that.  If someone struggles to get 1 Bitcoin, their living condition may not change because after owning the 1 Bitcoin they may set a new goal for themselves, and they may also develop a reluctance to want to even make any form of withdrawal to even try better the standard of their living. Some people have become so used to living frugally that even when they're in the position to improve their standard of living they still keep themselves living frugally. It is not a good way to live especially when you have been disciplined for a very long time, living below the proper standard of living. It is okay to improve your standard of living from the profit of your investment, the real wealth is in health, and an investment in the things around us that can improve and better our physical and mental health is not a waste.
